Ω×χ.Ω∘χ: Apply global constraint to an evolving state.
Ω×χ.χ∘Ω: Evolve a state restricted to the constraint surface.
Ω×χ.Ωχ\_H / Ωχ\_L: Define Hamiltonian/Lagrangian that ensures \[Ω, χ\] → 0 on allowed flows.

Ω×ψ.Ω∘ψ: Constrain wave fields to globally allowed modes.
Ω×ψ.ψ∘Ω: Wave evolution restricted to Ω-allowed subspace.
Ω×ψ.role: Mode spectrum selection, global normalization of ψ.

Ω×λ.Ω∘λ: Constrain curvature configurations to globally allowed geometry (e.g., global curvature bounds).

Ω×μ.Ω∘μ: Global constraint on local density distribution (e.g., total mass \= constant).
Ω×μ.μ∘Ω: Apply density to an already constrained configuration.

Ω×Θ.Ω∘Θ: Constraint with polarity (e.g., globally allowed sign configurations).
Ω×Θ.Θ∘Ω: Polarity routing restricted by global constraints.
Ω×Θ.role: Logical consistency conditions at global scale.

Ω internal.Ωχ\_H: Generator of χ evolution under Ω.
Ω internal.Ωχ\_L: Action functional encoding the same dynamics.

Ωχ Hamiltonian-Lagrangian Pair.equivalence: Ωχ\_H and Ωχ\_L describe the same constrained dynamics in Hamiltonian and Lagrangian form.
Ωχ Hamiltonian-Lagrangian Pair.relation: Ωχ\_H obtained by Legendre transform of Ωχ\_L where defined.
